docs.snippet: Thousands of New Yorkers who supported President Obama’s health plan are finding that their insurance plans are canceled and that they may have to accept inferior coverage....
docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of New Yorkers who supported President Obama’s health plan are finding that their insurance plans are canceled and that they may have to accept inferior coverage.
docs.abstract: Thousands of New Yorkers who supported President Obama’s health plan are finding that their insurance plans are canceled and that they may have to pay more or accept inferior coverage; most are independent practitioners who were part of group plans under informal New York system, but are now considered individuals under Obamacare.

docs.snippet: A New York Times/CBS News Poll finds a continued lack of confidence in the health care law, but willingness to spread blame for the online rollout....
docs.lead_paragraph: A New York Times/CBS News Poll finds a continued lack of confidence in the health care law, but willingness to spread blame for the online rollout.
docs.abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll shows that Pres Obama's approval ratings have returned to where they were before the rollout of the health care law's enrollment process, but Americans still lack confidence in the White House's management of the Affordable Care Act.

docs.abstract: Interviews reveal vast improvements to federal healthcare Web site, with users reporting far fewer errors a week after deadline set by Pres Obama for fixing the system.

docs.abstract: Navigators helping people enroll for health insurance through new federal Web site report slight improvements, but say clients remain deeply frustrated by hurdles and system freezes; progress remains slow despite weeks of work by a small army of software experts.

docs.lead_paragraph: The first lady, after years of evangelizing exercise and good eating habits, will begin an initiative on Tuesday that seeks to increase the number of low-income students who attend college.
docs.abstract: Michelle Obama, after nearly five years of evangelizing exercise and good eating habits, will begin a new initiative that seeks to increase the number of low-income students who pursue a college degree; program reflects first lady's own life and will immerse her more directly in her husband's policies.

docs.snippet: The Republicans are flirting with financial disaster....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Republicans are flirting with financial disaster.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column holds government shutdown would be a nuisance but nothing compared to failure to raise the debt ceiling, which could be economically disastrous; warns hitting the ceiling would force a huge, immediate spending cut, almost certainly pushing America back into recession; scores Republicans and the people who vote for them for flirting with financial disaster.

docs.abstract: Thousands of marchers participate in largest antigovernment protest in Bahrain in months, apparently emboldened by Pres Obama's mention of sectarian tensions there during his United Nations address.
